  • Session Functions

Session Functions

  • session - Get session class instance

  • session_destroy_all - Destroy all sessions

  • session_flash_get - Get session flash data item

  • session_flash_keep - Keep session flash data item

  • session_flash_set - Set session flash data item

  • session_get - Get session data item

  • session_get_metadata - Get session metadata

  • session_grant - Grant session access

  • session_has_access - Check if has access

  • session_revoke - Revoke session access

  • session_set - Set session data item

  • session_user - Get and/or set the current session user

Many of the session functions below are just aliases for the methods of the PHPCore Session Class.

See also

PHP Session Functions

Base PHP internal session functions that interface directly with the PHPCore Session Class.

PHP SessionHandler Class

Documentation for PHP internal SessionHandler Class.

PHPCore Session Feature

The PHPCore extended session handling features.

PHPCore Session Class

The PHPCore session class.

session()

Get session class instance

Returns the current session instance. If the session has not been started yet it will be started before the instance is returned.

Returns

object The current Session Class instance

Example 49 Get session object
 1<?php
 2// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 3// Set as variable
 4$sess = session();
 5echo $sess->getMetadata('session_id'); // 'srh6g2amog4hmbkvjpuj8urmfv'
 6
 7// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 8// Direct chain
 9echo session()->getMetadata('session_id'); // 'srh6g2amog4hmbkvjpuj8urmfv'
10
11?>

Back to list

session_destroy_all()

Destroy all sessions

Destroys ALL sessions if the save handlers supports this method.

Throws

Exception – If save handler does not support this method.

Returns

boolean Returns true on success or false on failure.

Note

Only the memcached save handler is supported at this time.

Example 50 Destroy all sessions
 1<?php
 2// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 3// Set as variable
 4$sess = session();
 5
 6// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 7// Initial page load
 8
 9echo session_id();                 // string 's319vde2dtjf888clm3m12tdno'
10var_dump($sess->getAllSessions()); // array [
11                                   //     '7bh6us2i64eum0vueofbtnsfkl',
12                                   //     's319vde2dtjf888clm3m12tdno',
13                                   //     'gj636nqn35ifkq9b6dr5ft11iv',
14                                   // ]
15session_destroy_all();
16
17
18// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
19// 1st page refresh
20
21echo session_id();                 // string 'am59ant4l8meialih84nmd5arv'
22var_dump($sess->getAllSessions()); // array [ 'am59ant4l8meialih84nmd5arv' ]
23
24?>

Back to list

session_flash_get(?string $key = null)

Get session flash data item

This method will return the flash data item that matches the provided key. If a key is not provided the entire flash data array will be returned.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the flash data item to retrieve

Returns

mixed Returns the flash data item

Example 51 Get flash data
 1<?php
 2
 3// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 4// Initial page load
 5
 6var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
 7session_flash_set('my-var', 123);
 8var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
 9
10
11// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
12// 1st page refresh
13
14var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // int 123
15
16
17// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
18// 2nd page refresh
19
20var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
21
22?>

Back to list

session_flash_keep(string $key)

Keep session flash data item

This method will keep a session flash data item for the next session.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the flash data item to keep

Returns

boolean Return true on success and false if item was not found

Example 52 Keep flash data
 1<?php
 2
 3// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 4// Initial page load
 5
 6var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
 7var_dump(session_flash_keep('my-var'); // false
 8session_flash_set('my-var', 123);
 9var_dump(session_flash_keep('my-var'); // false
10var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
11
12
13// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
14// 1st page refresh
15
16var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var'));          // int 123
17var_dump(session_flash_keep('nonexistent-var'); // false
18var_dump(session_flash_keep('my-var');          // true
19
20
21// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
22// 2nd page refresh
23
24var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var'));          // int 123
25
26
27// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
28// 3rd page refresh
29
30var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var'));          // null
31var_dump(session_flash_keep('my-var'));         // false
32
33?>

Back to list

session_flash_set(string $key, mixed $value)

Set session flash data item

This method will set a session flash data item to be used for the next session.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the flash data item

  • $value (mixed) – The value of the flash data item

Example 53 Set flash data
 1<?php
 2
 3// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 4// Initial page load
 5
 6var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
 7session_flash_set('my-var', 123);
 8var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
 9
10
11// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
12// 1st page refresh
13
14var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // int 123
15
16
17// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
18// 2nd page refresh
19
20var_dump(session_flash_get('my-var')); // null
21
22?>

Back to list

session_get(string $key = null)

Get session data item

This method is used to retrieve a session data item.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – Session Data Key

Returns

mixed Session Data

Example 54 Get session data
 1<?php
 2
 3session_set('test_perm', 123);
 4session_set('test_temp', time(), 60); // set ttl for 60 sec
 5var_dump(session_get('test_perm'));   // int 123
 6var_dump(session_get('test_temp'));   // int 1655112668
 7
 8// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 9// 1st page refresh 30 sec
10
11var_dump(session_get('test_perm')); // int 123
12var_dump(session_get('test_temp')); // int 1655112668
13var_dump(time());                   // int 1655112698
14
15// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
16// 2nd page refresh 60 sec
17
18var_dump(session_get('test_perm')); // int 123
19var_dump(session_get('test_temp')); // int 1655112668
20var_dump(time());                   // int 1655112728
21
22// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
23// 3rd page refresh 61 sec
24
25var_dump(session_get('test_perm')); // int 123
26var_dump(session_get('test_temp')); // null
27var_dump(time());                   // int 1655112729
28
29?>

Back to list

session_get_metadata(?string $key = null)

Get session metadata

This method will return metadata with a provided key. If no key is passed the entire metadata array will be returned.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – Metadata Key

Returns

mixed Session Metadata

Example 55 Get all sessions
 1<?php
 2
 3var_dump(session_get_metadata('session_id')); // srh6g2amog4hmbkvjpuj8urmfv
 4
 5var_dump(session_get_metadata());
 6
 7/*
 8Above will output something similar to:
 9
10[
11  'acl_groups' => [ 'GUEST', 'PUBLIC' ],
12  'started'    => 1654647866,
13  'session_id' => 'srh6g2amog4hmbkvjpuj8urmfv',
14  'timeleft'   => 27376,
15  'updated'    => 1654648614,
16  'user'       => null,
17]
18
19*/
20
21?>

Back to list

session_grant(string|array $groups)

Grant session access

This method grants session access via adding it the the acl_groups array in the sessions metadata.

Parameters

  • $groups (string|array) – ACL group or array of ACL groups to be granted

Example 56 Grant session access
1<?php
2
3var_dump(session_has_access('SPECIAL')); // false
4session_grant('SPECIAL');
5var_dump(session_has_access('SPECIAL')); // true
6
7?>

Back to list

session_has_access(string|array $groups)

Check if has access

This method checks if a session has access via checking if in the acl_groups array in the sessions metadata.

Parameters

  • $groups (string|array) – ACL group or array of ACL groups to check access for

  • $flags (integer) – Bitwise flags for this method

Flag

Session::HAS_ACCESS_ANY Has Access check true on ANY match

Flag

Session::HAS_ACCESS_ALL Has Access check true if ALL match

Returns

boolean If has session access

Example 57 Check for session access
 1<?php
 2
 3var_dump(session_has_access('SPECIAL')); // false
 4session_grant('SPECIAL');
 5var_dump(session_has_access('SPECIAL')); // true
 6
 7session_grant(['RED','BLUE']);
 8var_dump(session_has_access(['RED','BLUE']);  // true
 9var_dump(session_has_access(['RED','GREEN']); // true
10var_dump(session_has_access(['RED','GREEN'], Session::HAS_ACCESS_ALL); // false
11var_dump(Session_has_access(['RED','GREEN'], Session::HAS_ACCESS_ANY); // true
12
13?>

Back to list

session_revoke(string|array $groups)

Revoke session access

This method removes session access via removing from acl_groups array in the sessions metadata.

Parameters

  • $groups (string|array) – ACL group or array of ACL groups to be revoked

Example 58 Revoke session access
 1<?php
 2
 3session_grant('SPECIAL');
 4var_dump(session_has_access('SPECIAL')); // true
 5session_revoke('SPECIAL')
 6var_dump(session_has_access('SPECIAL')); // false
 7
 8session_grant(['RED','BLUE']);
 9var_dump(session_has_access(['RED','BLUE'], Session::HAS_ACCESS_ALL); // true
10session_revoke(['RED','BLUE'])
11var_dump(session_has_access(['RED','BLUE'], Session::HAS_ACCESS_ANY); // false
12
13?>

Back to list

session_set(string $key, mixed $val, ?int $ttl = null)

Set session data item

This method is used to store a session data item. If the optional $ttl is passed the data item will also be given an expiration.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – Key of session data item to set.

  • $value (mixed) – Value of session data item to set.

  • $ttl (?integer) – Time To Live for this data item.

Example 59 Set session data
 1<?php
 2
 3session_set('test_perm', 123);
 4session_set('test_temp', time(), 60); // set ttl for 60 sec
 5var_dump(session_get('test_perm'));   // int 123
 6var_dump(session_get('test_temp'));   // int 1655112668
 7
 8// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 9// 1st page refresh 30 sec
10
11var_dump(session_get('test_perm')); // int 123
12var_dump(session_get('test_temp')); // int 1655112668
13var_dump(time());                   // int 1655112698
14
15// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
16// 2nd page refresh 60 sec
17
18var_dump(session_get('test_perm')); // int 123
19var_dump(session_get('test_temp')); // int 1655112668
20var_dump(time());                   // int 1655112728
21
22// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
23// 3rd page refresh 61 sec
24
25var_dump(session_get('test_perm')); // int 123
26var_dump(session_get('test_temp')); // null
27var_dump(time());                   // int 1655112729
28
29?>

Back to list

session_user(?string $user = null)

Get and/or set the current session user

If the $user parameter is used the acl_groups will be replaced with the ones declared in the acl_group.default_user directive and the session start time will also be reset.

Parameters

  • $user (string) – The user to bind to the current session

Returns

string|null User of the current session

Example 60 Get / Set session user
 1<?php
 2
 3var_dump(session_user()); // null
 4session_user('12345')
 5var_dump(session_user()); // string '12345'
 6
 7// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 8// page refresh
 9var_dump(session_user()); // string '12345'
10
11?>

Back to list
